info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 7 at 6:16AM EDT until April 7 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Peachtree City GA
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia...
Coosawattee River near Ellijay affecting Gilmer County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Coosawattee River near Ellijay.
* WHEN...Until this evening.
* IMPACTS...At 8 feet, Flood Stage is reached and minor flooding begins upstream and downstream from the gage off Legion Road. Some flooding will begin in low spots along the walking trail of the Harold Hefner River Park and in the parking lot of the American Legion Post 82 on Legion Road.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM EDT Monday the stage was 6.6 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 8.4 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this morning. - Flood stage is 8 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING
